author: Mental.health
title: Mental health team
body:
I have been struggling for as long as I can remember. Last February I asked my GP to refer me to mental health team for assessment. I had multiple appointments booked and all of them cancelled. Most recently I was supposed to have assessment in August, which was cancelled without any knowledge to me, then rescheduled to today (I only received the letter 4 days ago), but today again nobody rang me. I tried ringing them after multiple different departments. I was finally told that yes my appointment was rescheduled for next month.  
They do not seem to care. I have been begging to be seen, to have some sort of help but they just do not appear to care. I was very upset this morning with the lack of care on their part but all they could say is I need to ring the crisis team as they will be able to talk to me. I do not need to talk to crisis team I need actual help. I need someone to listen and guide me which just is not happening.  
I feel I am being let down over and over again and honestly because of this I feel more suicidal than ever. I have restarted using strong antidepressants since the last appointment was just cancelled and nobody let me know about it. I can wholeheartedly say that my mental health has gone downhill due to them ignoring my begs for help.

readBy.name: Coventry and Warwickshire Partnership NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: oscarbr38
title: Helpful receptionist
body:
I had never been to the Queen Elizabeth University Hospital, and was unsure where I had to go for my Macular eye injections. I attended at the start of October and asked the receptionist, who told me to take the escalator to the first floor and turn left to waiting room. She then asked me if I was able to use the escalator.  
This may not seem much, but she quickly recognised my eye condition and was wanting me to be safe. This attention to detail speaks volumes for the skill and professionalism of this receptionist.

title: great practice
body: surgeries get a lot of bad press, but this does not apply to Newbury. we have been with this practice for many many years and have always found everybody very helpful. on my recent last  call receptionist listened to my problem & even managed to get me appointment with Doctor on same day & i managed to start my medication immediately.

title: Overall good practice
body: I booked a face to face appointment online, although the doctor was running slightly late it was an overall good experience.

title: Staff rude and referral not send until after 2…
body:
I had a phone appointment with one of the clinicians beginning of August, following the appointment she will send a referral out for Gynecology and I should receive the letter through the post.  2 months later I chase the referral but it wasn't  sent.  The receptionist was talking to me like I have disturb her and was unclear about what should I expect regarding my referral, put the phone down. I had to call back so I can get clear information,receptionist didn't ask again for date of birth or name. In a very annoyed and rude manner she said that she will write a message to clinician and I should wait.
NHS has zero tolerance for abuse towards staff. What about if staff is rude towards patients ,where can we go if not even the GP can be a safe place anymore.  Waiting 2 months for a referral o be sent, then wait 6-8 months on the waiting list. If someone has cancer 6-8 months might be to late.

title: A covid death trap
body: In the middle of a Covid wave, no Covid precautions whatsoever to protect patients and staff. No ventilation (windows closed), reception staff not in masks, most patients not wearing masks, one coughing violently and complaining of Covid symptoms, and a long wait in these deathtrap conditions. A complete failure of clinical responsibility to patients!

title: Great practice
body: I always feel well looked after by this practice.  All staff from reception to GP and everyone in between are always helpful and do their best to help patients.

title: Happy with practice
body: We are really happy at Garden City. I know they are under pressure but they do try and do what they can to help. You can pre book appointments and also ring on the day . Very helpful and efficient

title: Good luck getting an appointment
body: Firstly I must say it you manage to get an appointment even after days of trying once you see a doctor they mostly do a good job, but getting an appointment is way below what it should be, you phone in the morning and have a very long wait on the phone and then after once you eventually get through you are told there are no appointments and to phone back tomorrow at 08-30 to go through this all again and be told the same again and to phone back tomorrow,this really is not  at the level it should be, Google reviews comes in at around 2.0 out of 5 for people's rating of the surgery which is not a coincidence.

title: finally happy.
body: There are two new doctors, both good but one I prefer and hope never leaves! Absolutely amazing professionalism, very helpful and non-judgmental, very kind, not in a rush to see you out but will go through everything thoroughly and wants to help. Really restored my faith in having to see the GP. Thank you so much.

title: Treated like a gentleman.
body: I was 10 minutes early for my appointment but was seen immediately I arrived.  I saw three female technicians who each carried out tests on my eyes.  They were very professional and extremely polite and I could not have had a better experience if I had paid to be seen privately.  They were a credit to the NHS.

title: Excellent all around
body:
Knee replacement. There was a short wait from to referral to the Initial Consultation which was thorough and quick. I opted to accept a short notice cancellation for the operation so that happened around 6 weeks later in March 2021. The operation went well and I was discharged after 2 nights in a single room with en-suite facilities. All of the staff were lovely and very efficient and the food provided was very good too. 
Unfortunately, the expected physio from the NHS didn't happen (probably due to Covid etc) so I did use the private physio service which was a reasonable price for an excellent service. 
When my other knee needs replacing, I would choose this hospital again.

title: Excellent practice
body: The day after a phone appointment I had a face to face with a doctor .only waited 2 mins before being called in by the doctor herself to consulting room .I was made to feel comfortable and doctor gave me a full examination and put me at ease with diagnosis

title: Poor service
body: Long wait to access reception via phone. Delays in completing prescription request resulting in delays of much needed medicine. Currently looking at alternative surgery to move my care to

title: Worst experience
body: I have to wait for more than an hour on the call for just getting the results on my test . I haven't ever come across a practice like this . I would rather not see the GP at all than going through the ordeal of waiting for an hour on the call

author: coordinationsz56
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Friendly and nice staff on Coronary Care
body:
After developing chest pains, I came to the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital. My experience here was alright. I had about a 7 hour wait but all the staff were lovely and very good during this time.  
I was then transferred up to the Coronary Care Ward. It has been absolutely fine on this ward. All the staff have been very friendly and very nice. When it comes to communication with staff it has been alright - their explanations have been good.  
The food has been alright - I don't have much of an appetite but it has been alright. The ward has been kept clean, as have the toilets etc.  
The only issue I have encountered would be in regards to the showers. I have found it to be a bit slippery at times. There is also nowhere to put your clothes to prevent them from getting absolutely soaked. Other than this, my stay has been overall good and I am happy with the care provided by the staff here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Awful
body: Impossible to get through via phone to book appointment let alone to get to see a GP face to face. To receive a call from a GP providing 'advice' but offering no support or signposting to other sources of support unacceptable. Rude GP who doesn't accept patients are entitled to their own personal opinion. This practice needs to be inspected as it's not fit for purpose. Unable to deal with volume of patients it has on its register but recently 'advertising' registering new patients. Unbelievable

title: Shocking.
body: Once again I can’t get an appointment. I tried ringing today and the receptionist told me there were " no appointments". She didn’t even ask me why I was ringing. So I’m not sure how she can decide whether or not I needed one. I was actually in tears when I got off the phone, as I don’t know what to do anymore! I need an appointment and can’t get one. It’s not fair on patients who genuinely need to be seen by a GP! I am also shocked to discover that you are accepting " new patients" when you can’t even offer your current ones appointments ! I am considering just leaving and finding a new surgery in the hope I get the right care elsewhere, even since the pandemic farfield has turned into a complete and utter shambles of a GP surgery. I’m sorry if that sounds harsh, but I’m sure many can agree.

title: Very satisfied
body: I always feel satisfied with the service provided by Kingsbridge. I feel that I'm listened to and action is then taken to sort out any issue.

title: Complete waste of time
body:
I am not sure why practices like this receive any funding from the NHS as they make it practically impossible to get an appointment...and then will no doubt berate a patient for not seeing them earlier when an illness does happen.  There is no ability to book for appointments coming up, just a daily scramble/lottery on places for the day, quite how they expect anyone to plan their day around this ludicrous state of affairs is beyond me.  

Save your time and energy, simple go elsewhere if possible.

title: Almost impossible to speak to a Doctor here
body:
Took an hour of ringing every 5 minutes this morning to finally get in a queue to be told there are no appointments. I can ring back every morning at 8.30 am or every afternoon at 2.30pm in the hope there may be one, but there may not be one, I was told. I explained I work and don’t have the type of job where I can leave to make a call. The receptionist said ‘there’s nothing we can do!’ And ‘I haven’t got any appointments for you!’ Asked for an appointment at West Heath and was told I couldn’t have one there (have had appointments there previously), was questioned about why I was ringing in detail (this isn’t a nurse triaging needs). I stressed the urgency of needing to see/speak to a doctor, she asked me to leave it with her (suggesting there are appointments available), just to ring me back to tell me to ring back this afternoon or go to A & E (not the place I should be going). Rang back this afternoon and was told ‘there are no appointments available at the moment’ Told to phone the Walk-in Centre (not an option this morning). Booked an appointment as a back up - 10 days time. This time it was offered as a face to face appointment (not an option given this morning). Since spent an hour so far on the phone to the walk in centre with 5 people ahead of me, and no change in this.
This is consistent practice for this surgery. Please consider that the current system is not working and make changes. We cannot register at another practice but equally, it is virtually impossible to get appointments here. Even the online booking system is not up and running anymore, meaning the surgery is flooded with calls that cannot respond effectively to. Having a non-medically trained person triaging your needs and questioning you for sensitive information is unacceptable, especially when it is met with no empathy. And being told constantly that there is nothing we can do for you, when you are at your most vulnerable and reaching out for help, does not reflect any care values among the NHS. 
I am pleased to say seeing/speaking to a Doctor here has always been a good experience. However, being offered the opportunity to be able to use this service is becoming impossible!

title: Fabulous Practice
body: The Partners and Doctors and all the staff are completely Patient orientated, kind and listen to your problems and then offer the best solutions to them, I cannot recommend this practice high enough, they never hesitate in booking blood tests or further tests to ensure that they have covered everything

title: Unfriendly receptionist
body: I phoned the surgery for a new fit note as it expired 4thOctober but the receptionist told me I should ring back tmorrow as it was valid till 5thOctober.I had copy in front of me but she wasn’t having it.Ithen asked if I needed to call back to see if fit note would be ready to collect and she replied…same as last time..you’ve had one before.The practice is full of polite and helpful receptionists…and amazing doctors…why is this one woman letting everyone down.?If she’s not happy in her job…release her…there’s lots of people would love her job.

title: Care and compassion
body: I visited recently for a woman's-health check up. Whilst there I asked about another health condition that had been bugging me. The nurse went out of her way to make time to see me for breathing issues I had had since covid. She literally couldn’t of done any more to help me that day and I will be forever grateful for her care and compassion. The doctor even came in and saw me and listened to my chest and ordered some tests for me which was incredibly kind considering they are all always so pushed for time.  Thank you for your kindness. You both literally made me feel so important and listened to.

title: So pleased.
body: A very thorough examination and further tests request leaving me confident and relieved. I felt I was listened  to with no feelings of being rushed at all. A further appointment was made on the day to discuss the results. I felt so much more confident when I left the surgery.

title: Warm and welcoming staff.
body: The staff at the practice are warm and very helpful. I've yet to meet a doctor but the nursing staff and the ladies at the reception were very kind and quite helpful.

title: A Very Good Pratice
body: I was very grateful that I could be slotted in at very short notice, it meant I could get my problem treated and the medication cleared it up quickly. So I must thank the receptionist who helped sort out the appointment with the doctor so quickly.

title: Excellent care and patient experience.
body: Everyone at the Practice is exceptionally helpful and attentive. Appointments and repeat prescriptions are easily accessible and the medical staff are caring and address all concerns effectively. I feel very fortunate to be a patient here.

title: Supportive beyond expectations
body: Having spoken to a gp previously about my mental health and been told I just need to 'exercise more', I was very apprehensive. But the gp at the student health centre not only made me feel incredibly comfortable, but they ensured I felt in control of what treatment I had. They supported me in contacting the ucmht team and then in progressing onto medication which has transformed my life. They are now supporting me in winding down that medication even though I have left the University, while I transfer over to my new gp, so I don't feel unsupported. I really wish there was more recognition of the role the nhs and practices such as this within them play within people's lives. I wouldn't be here without this practice and my gp and I will be forever grateful.

title: Endoscopy Unit
body:
I have literally just returned from my appointment and cannot praise the unit high enough.. From reception to being discharged was actually a real pleasure and was made to feel right at home, with everyone having smiles + the ladies in the unit were very caring and  patient with me... So thank you 
So thank you all

title: Punctual and friendly
body: Punctual didn’t wait long and friendly. Was made to feel comfortable and had confidence with the nurse.

title: Excellent staff and doctors
body: Treated me with care and support and respect, I was so relaxed with the doctor he was very good and easy to talk to in which I struggle with. And the phone call back after as well.

title: Great practice
body: I was contacted by the practice to inform me l could make an appointment for my covid vaccine and was given a slot to attend a couple of days later.  When l attended l was seen straightaway and the whole experience was very well organised and speedy.

title: Excellent care
body: Many thanks to all for the prompt and excellent tratment in the minor injuries this evening. Excellent stitchwork on a nasty wound!!

title: Superb Service
body: Yet again superb, courteous efficient service. Thank you for offering such a wonderful facility. As always I feel I am in safe hands.

title: Great practice
body: The appointment was on time, no wait time, carried out very efficiently and very well organised with no after effects.

title: Caring and empathetic
body: Went to MRU nurse who did cannula was so caring took time to find right vein, put me at ease with her lovely chat and for the first time it wasn't painful. Porters were great too upbeat and very reassuring. The specialist i saw was just amazing. I can actually say I had a very relaxed day out. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust

author: julyqr64
title: Brilliant stay but a few things need improving
body:
I came to Daisy Hill Hospital initially for a planned echocardiogram. The staff were all brilliant during the echo. I was then admitted onto the Coronary Care ward following the echo.  
It has been absolutely great on the ward. The staff have all been absolutely great – I have had no problems with them. I would particularly like to mention nurses Grainne and Caitlin. They have been absolutely excellent and fantastic. Marty the cleaner has also been very good – he has been very nice and helps keep the ward clean and tidy. Communication with staff has also been good.  
When it comes to the food – it really needs to be improved. I don’t eat it a lot of the time as it is just not to the appropriate standard. Breakfast is particularly bad – it is always very bland and very dry. I cannot even bring myself to order breakfast.  
The only other issue I have noticed would be in regards to the toilet. Sometimes there are samples sitting in there for over an hour – this shouldn’t be the case.  
Apart from this, my stay has been good and I have had no other issues.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful team
body: I went and had my annual flu job at Crownhill Surgery/Pathfields. The team were very organised, friendly and helpful. They always are welcoming and have a smile on their face for patients. It was a bit hectic for people trying to park and arriving in cars, I walked. I can’t fault the practice or staff in anyway, it all went smoothly and didn’t hurt at all.

title: Dr akbars is a great practice and very…
body:
Since I have moved in to Bradford 12yrs ago I registered to DR Akbar surgery on Wheatley lane, and I can say it has been amazing from the staff in reception and the doctors
And there is one particular Dr her name
Is Dr Esha Hussian she is amazing and soo thoughtful and soo caring and sooo understanding and always giving the best advice and confidence what a patient needs as I worry a lot about anything and everything but she is always willing to listen and advice me what to do and where to go. We need more doctors like that . God bless you NHS for
Having such a wonderful Dr like Dr Esha Hussian 👍 always thumbs up for her.🤩

title: Great practice
body: Quick and efficient service with high standards of care. Very pleasant, professional and caring staff. The practice is always clean and presentable. Never experienced any appointment delays or last minute cancellations.

author: learningxd49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Cannot thank staff enough
body:
After having severe difficulties with my arthritis, I was admitted onto the Female Medical Ward at Daisy Hill Hospital. I really cannot thank the staff here enough for helping to get me back up onto my feet.  
The staff on the ward have all been absolutely brilliant - doctors and nurses included. This is my second stay in Daisy Hill and it has been brilliant on both occasions. I couldn't single any staff member out as they have all just been so good to me. All the staff are excellent communicators and also know how to have a laugh with you which is good too.  
The ward itself is always kept clean. All the food, tea etc. has all been fantastic as well.  
I have no improvements to suggest. With the Health Service being so short staffed they are doing absolutely brilliant in difficult circumstances.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent experience
body: I rang as required at 8 a.m. my call was answered within 5- 7 minutes. I was asked a few pertinent questions and offered a telephone appointment that day. I was told the doctor may offer me a face to face if they felt it necessary. The GP rang a time frame which ı was then offered a face to face appointment. I was given an examination and treated accordingly. At all times surgery staff were polite and competent and I was dealt with in timely manner as the male ı was talking to on the phone ı saw him in person so ı then thanked him for his  attitude to patient care at this time of need as ı was feeling very poorly so the Dr then helped me further

title: Fantastic service and improved care
body: I have recieved nothing but kindness and willingness at this surgery. I have been registered here since it was dr driver and partner and ı am so impressed with the care coordination and its  direction it  shows to myself and other patients. Keep up the good work for many that need to hear this. Well done to the collegue of yours always helping he is always smart dressed and supportive to me and my family at anytime he is around.

title: Fantastic service from Childrens A&E
body: I took my 2 year old child into A&E for breathing difficulties. She was seen by a nurse immediately and by a doctor within the hour. Given medicine and regularly checked on by multiple staff members. The best service I’ve ever had at this hospital although they are always fantastic with children

title: Wonderful experience
body: I’ve only joined the practice recently and I’ve had a wonderful experience so far, the staff are very courteous and helpful, questions are answered and all concerns properly addressed. I can’t fault them in any way.

author: snowkh68
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Stay couldn't be any better for me
body:
I came to Daisy Hill Hospital via ambulance after developing a serious chest infection. The ambulance crew were 110% and more. They really couldn't do enough for me - I have absolutely no complaints.  
I was eventually admitted onto the Female Medical Ward. You honestly couldn't beat it on the ward. I have not got one complaint from my time here. The staff are all great - really very lovely. I should point out that all the staff members are good but Rose, Agnes and Susan have been exceptional.  
The ward itself is clean - no problems there. The staff are always on hand to make sure that anything you want you can get. The food has also been quite good - I really cannot complain.  
I have no suggestions for improvement that I can think of - I honestly couldn't ask for better than what I have got.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: very impressed
body: New to the surgery but had a bit of a worry. I got in to see a lovely Nurse Practitioner who put me at ease. A really nice cool room.Its a busy surgery lots of people coming in and out the rooms and through the main doors. Given that Everything is spotlessly clean, Toilets are fresh as well. Its a clean, organised and professional place and the staff are very friendly and greet you with a smile and eager to please.

title: Brillant
body:
I joined this surgery in 1999 and left in Oct 2022 during those years nothing was too much trouble, the reception staff are a1, always very helpful, very easy to talk to, and a caring nature, lovely, lovely ladies thank you.
The nurses are great, ready to listen and always ready to help in anyway that they can.
The Doctors....I've seen a few over the years, I've cried, I've moaned, I've poured my heart out to them when life was to much never once did they send me away without doing their very best to help me. Always been very good at getting test done, or referring me to hospital. 
22 years I was with this surgery and can only say with all honesty  they are great, I've been with a few practice's over the years and West street surgery are first class.  Thank You so much.

title: 100 questions and still no appointment
body: I have been a patient at the surgery for many years.  I recently had cause to request an appointment.  Upon calling, I was faced with 15 minutes of questions (very personal) about the condition, by a receptionist.  All I wanted was an appointment to see my doctor.  Upon asking why so many questions, the reply was "they have asked for as much information as possible".  When i pointed out that all was in my file, the comment was "we don't have time to look at records".  During the questioning, comments such as "well that's not that bad" were made.  I have to say that if this is now the state of GP surgeries, I understand why people complain so much and chose to self diagnose/medicate.  I was under the impression that GP practices were there to help.  Very very sad situation

title: Good
body: When it comes to my children being seen they are always seen very quickly ,it can take along time however to be on the phone waiting for an appointment but I do understand that there very busy and under staffed as are many other places too , but I’m happy with  there services

title: Massive call wait times
body: Have been on hold 1hr 35 mins to speak to a receptionist and have been caller number 3 for the last twenty mins. I am trying to cancel an appointment for a flu jab that I can’t make and want the appointment to go to someone else and not be wasted but this huge wait time to just get through coupled with the cost of the call makes it unlikely many would do the same leading to missed appointments and wasted resource.

title: Telephone issues
body: The surgery lists on its website that it closes at 6.30.  I tried to phone at 6 p.m. The recorded message says that the surgery is open until 6.30. Then it says that "the surgery is now closed". What is the truth? Most annoying.

title: Room for improvement
body: My daughters appointment was 15.30, at 16.30 I went to reception to enquire about the appointment. I was told there had been an emergency with the last patient. I understand these things happen, but I would have been more understanding if someone had cone to us and explained, rather that leaving us there for an hour.

title: Continued Great Service
body: Dr Batchelor is a credit to her profession. Face to face or E-Consult to monitoring ongoing issue.  Thank you

title: Superb Treatment
body: Thankyou to the Stroke Unit,  The Consultants, Registrar(s), doctors, nurses, Physio, O/T, Health Care, Cleaners, Secretaries and any others I have missed in the Unit, what a first class service and very professional approach.  As a family we will be eternally grateful.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
I have always had excellent treatment for all members of staff at The Hollies. 
The medical staff are professional,  efficient & empathetic.
 The receptionists are very pleasant & helpful. 
I had my annual check last week & my flu vaccine injection on Saturday 1st October. 
The HCA at the check up was welcoming & listened well to my concerns. She managed to take my blood without causing any discomfort whatsoever!
The flu vaccine clinic on Saturday had been well thought through & well planned resulting in a quick, efficient & steady flow of patients going through.  
I was in & out with in 5 minutes. 
 I would heartedly recommend this practice.

title: Professional staff
body: Thank you all the team at atherleigh I was in a horrible place you have actually saved my life and hopefully will soon see better day's 🙏 especially the staff on sovereign ward

title: Kinsley Ward Urology
body: Such kind, willing and calming staff. So attentive and helpful, always cheerful. Doctors and Surgeon explained everything carefully and fully.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great practice
body:
The environment was clean and quiet with friendly staff. The nurse is also friend,she went through details perfectly and examination was done professionally. 
It's a memorable experience.

title: Great Practice
body: Attended Leigh Family Practice today for annual flu jabs.  The car parks and roads near practice were extremely busy.. I though we'll be here for hours.  Booked in and went upstairs to clinic.  Both me and husband were straight in and back in car within 5 mins.  Everyone so polite and helpful as always.  Brilliant staff.

title: Improved Practice
body:
The practice has improved over last 6 months
Better understanding from reception staff to the needs of patient

title: Brilliant practice
body: This practice must be one of the best , nothing is too much trouble if you have a problem they are very thorough . All the staff from the receptionists to the doctors are so friendly and understanding. I’m very lucky to be a patient there

title: Great experience
body: I came with arm and chest pain. A&E was very busy but great efficiency and I finally ended up in the GP service. All tests were completed -bloods and X-ray and the GP was excellent and didn’t rush the consultation despite how busy it was. I felt listened to and can’t fault the staff and the service

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Friendly, helpful practice
body: I saw one of the practice nurses,who provided me with excellent advice and care. Thank you. She was very thorough and reassuring.

title: Excellent care
body: I had cataract surgery which was painless, swift and completely successful. The nursing and surgical staff were empathetic, patient, caring and utterly professional. I was told, in detail what would happen and given excellent after care advice. Looking forward to having the other eye done now!

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb practice
body: The doctors and nurses at this practice have never been anything short of excellent,  they're like friends you feel so comfortable with them

title: Very Friendly
body: Walked in the door and they welcomed me. Showed me where to go, engaged in conversation and helped with any queries I had

title: Great Flu vaccine clinic
body: Very well organised, with a queue system as well as appointment slots. I was in and out very quickly. Friendly & caring staff.

title: Great response to an acute problem
body: Once I had been triaged, I was given several options for an appointment (at different Practices) and was seen the same day.  My appt was on time and the Dr was excellent and professional throughout.

title: Efficient and friendly
body: Was told to visit A&E after calling 111 about fainting and a head injury. I was super suprised to be in and out so quickly. The reception staff were making sure only the people with a genuine need to be there were in which must have helped kept the waiting time down. I saw 3 members of staff, Charlotte in triage, someone who did my ECG and finally a doctor (sorry I can't remember names) everyone was super friendly and calm. Credit to the doctor who explained everything and made sure I understood and was happy with everything before I left. It was my first time visiting A&E at BRI and while I have no intention of doing so again, it is nice to know that that level of service exists despite the immense pressure the NHS faces. Thank you!

title: Well oiled machine for flu jabs
body: A very efficient and streamlined exercise from booking to the actual vaccination.  So much easier to do than use the pharmacy who doubled up on messages but didn't follow through with an actual appointment.  By comparison, it's well worth waiting for the practice to contact you as the whole exercise was very professional and extremely friendly.

title: Flu clinic
body: Short stay all went swiftly and good practice..safety rules followed..kate is a lovely nurse and makes you feel at ease

author: asteropeen83
title: Wasted hours
body:
9.48pm call made to 999 on the instruction of the district nurse team. After having explained my father in law’s symptoms - unable to stand, very disorientated and incoherent. Told by the ambulance caller that “it wasn’t an ambulance case” and I was instructed to phone the GP or NHS24, I questioned calling the GP at the week-end- they asked if I had understood what had been said - which I clearly did, but didn’t agree with it! Which didn’t make them happy. Now let me tell you we do not call an ambulance lightly.  
I then called NHS24 as the GP Surgery isn’t open at the week-end. I was on hold for 45mins and eventually the call was ended at 1hr 15mins. During the call I explained that this is the way that he goes when he has an infection. He was found to have contracted E Coli after his last hospital admittance (he has a catheter). This was never verbally explained to anyone. We had tested him for Covid by this point, which was negative. She said that an out of hours doctor would call.  
00.38 On call doctor called. They said there was no point in coming down as he would probably end up going to hospital anyway! They would call an ambulance to take patient to hospital, I asked for a rough time scale one hour!  
01.38 no ambulance. Took his temperature 38.6  
03.08 call came from ambulance control informed her of rise in temperature now 39.0  
03.37 call from ambulance control - an ambulance was on its way.  
04.15 ambulance arrived temp now 39.4  
05.15 ambulance arrived at IRH. The ambulance staff showed genuine care.  
05.45 wife allowed to go in.  
Going to a ward…we left hospital at 07.45.  
This was the story of a nearly 80 year old who has had two strokes and who has recurring infections (no one has specifically explained what type and where the infections are).  
Since being admitted to hospital on a regular occurrence and with recurring UTI (we think) he has never once been visited by his own GP. All antibiotics have either been prescribed by a Nurse practitioner (not from own GP Practice) or a doctor over the phone.  
Urine samples have been handed in, but never has a sample been asked for after a course of antibiotics.  
He is still in hospital over 10 days after the call - no doctor/consultant has spoken to update the family. He is only now able to hold a cup and drink by himself - he is still talking gobbledegook and on an IV Drip. No explanation given!

title: Don’t bother
body: My daughter injured her wrist at nursery. We waited for 4.5 hours to be booked in at urgent treatment unit only to be told that no staff there can read xrays of under 5s. I had to go there urgenyly without having breakfast and with only my key on me. my daughter became hungry waiting all that time too. This is complete torture. Animals are treated much better.

title: Used to be the best
body:
This used to be one of the best practices in Grimsby but since COVID lockdown I don't know what has happened to it.

Monitoring of conditions requiring regular tests is non existent.

As for getting to talk to a doctor let alone actually seeing one you have more chance of winning the lottery!

title: No call back
body: I asked for a call from a doctor and was promised one before 6pm on a Thursday, still waiting for that call!!! It was urgent

title: Excellent service, staff are lovely
body: Can't rate this surgery high enough, reception staff were lovely and really helpful, the Dr I saw was excellent and explained everything, put my mind st rest, the nurse I saw for my blood test was so caring.

title: Problems with the appointments process
body: When calling for an appointment, an automated message urges us to book via the practice website. It's not easy to find the right one or to navigate it when you do. One page lists the restricted types of appointment you can book online; another asks for a keyword for the ailment but didn't recognise arthritis.  So, you're obliged to go back and phone, blocking up the queuing system.  I was then told no, I wouldn't be able to book an appointment online because the GP I'm registered with has just gone on maternity leave.  [How was I to know?/ was her maternity leave not scheduled well in advance?/ couldn't the website have been updated?]. I'm writing this comment here because I couldn't find any email address for the surgery.  [How many public organisations deny access to an email address these days? ] So, a suggestion, please: can the Village Surgery in Harpenden please invest in a better website and have it properly managed? This isn't rocket science and the current inefficiencies negatively impact on you and your patients - the waiting times by phone are extraordinary, partly as a result of an online system that doesn't work & the absence of an email facility. A good clinical practice needs to review its patient-facing access, I suggest.

title: Good
body:
Flu jab expertly organised..
I am not a fan of the general booking system - only being able to email for an appointment between 8 & 8.30 a.m seems unnecessarily restrictive.

title: Amazing Practice
body: This is such a lovely practice to be with. Whenever I have been unwell I have had no issues getting an appointment the same day. Last week I rang reception at 4.30pm and was offered a face2face appointment at 5.10pm the same day! How fantastic was that! The GP I saw was very kind and professional who made me feel at ease. I was able to open up to him and he listened carefully without me feeling rushed in the consultation. I would highly recommend this friendly practice as all staff working here in my experience are highly competent in their roles. I always feel that I am in safe hands. I wouldn't want to go anywhere else.

title: Helpful nurse
body:
Rang four times and after a long wait the phone would just cut out. Frustrated I went to the surgery to request an appointment and a nurse took me in right away between her appointments. I was in and out within 5 mins and collected my medication on the way home. 
Getting through might be difficult but I can’t fault their staff

title: Phone Message Too Long
body: You call at 8am and get an outdated message regarding covid and takes 2 mins to even be able to pick an option!! Sort your phone message out to make it shorter! People do not have the time to phone at 8am and then listen to a message regarding covid and face masks! We just want an appointment not a messages from 2020/2021 and when one finally gets through the staff all say different things! Please train your staff as it can be confusing when you are told something different every time you call!

title: Awful practice
body: We are this Cedar Brook Practice since 2019. If you want to see the doctor or at least talk to them, it's easier to go to the A&E!!! They never answer the phone, the receptionists are rude and to just speak with a doctor for an emergency, it takes weeks!!!

title: Great doctors but very poor access to be seen
body: When I have been able to access the service, the service was good. What makes me seriously thinking of finding a new GP is the utter impossibility of even get a doctor to answer queries via email. How can a practice work on the assumption that access for 4 to 15 minutes a day from 8 am are acceptable? This is shocking and unsustainable. Don't go there! I haven't seen my own GP for years. That would not bother me too much if I could see or even speak to someone else. But even that is a logistical nightmare. I will look for better access to healthcare if possible.

title: Thank you!
body: Did a stupid thing with a carving knife and want to express my gratitude for the care received in A&E, especially to Doc who managed the wound but also to the whole team. You should be very proud of the service you provide under challenging circumstances. Thank you!! David

title: Good Communication
body: The doctor listened to my complaint , prescribed a course of tablets which have worked very effectively, as well as arranging an appointment with a specialist within ten days.

title: Take too long no enough doctors
body:
Worst  clinic  there no any system they can take people randomly but never checked who’s first 
I went 7 hours before but not getting turned and whenever ask to the counter they said we don’t know when doctors call you also i know who behind came to me they got all number

title: Impossible to get an appointment
body: I have not required a visit in 8 years.  Tried to call and was excited that line picked up straight away. Oh my. False hope.  You have to listen for nearly a minute  recorded message before you can escape to reroute number.  Then another 30 second message to be put through to an engaged line. Wow I am glad my calls are free.  What a shambles.   There are still people that are still charged per call. You should be ashamed.   This is exactly the reason why I like many others end up at the doors of GWH.

author: Orca
title: Ambulance who decides who gets one?
body:
In July my brother became unwell (he suffers from epilepsy) and was assisted by homecare staff. I arrived whilst they were helping him back to bed and made sure he was okay. Later I arrived to find him on the floor, unable to get up. I helped him to his feet and decided he would be more comfortable in the living room. While attempting this he fell and hit his head on the radiator and was clearly not well.  
I phoned 999, described what was happening to him and was refused an emergency ambulance. I was told to call 111 which I did and spoke to the call handler. I described what was going on. They spoke with him and decided that he was not well and went to speak to a nurse who then advised that they could send an ambulance but it would take up to 6 hours.  
I decided if I could get help from Homecare staff to get him to Hospital A&E, I would take him myself, which I did. I felt totally alone, disgusted and in fear for for my brothers life. Epilepsy can and does cause death if not dealt with urgently.  
At Hairmyres Hospital paramedics helped me get him into A&E department (thankful for their help) and spent 90 mins for triage nurse to look at him. He became more unwell whilst sitting there and at 4 in the morning got into a cubicle, then 30mins later saw a doctor.  
May I ask who decides when to send an ambulance?

title: Great staff
body: I was sent to the wrong department for my gall bladder removel but the staff there were really helpful finding where I should be once I was on thd ward (19l) the staff couldn't do enough for you very attentive esp a student nurse . When I went to theatre the staff really put me at ease  an overall good experience .

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good people
body: Flu clinic organised very well.  The throughput was swift.  Why don't the NHS inoculation service liaise with the local GPs so that I am only called by the GP service and not both services? I had to go to the GP for flu and the NHS service for Covid booster.  Both jabs could have been carried out at the GP clinic. Time and resource-wasting.

title: Great GP
body: Friendly, approachable, they listen instead of assuming, the only down side, it is really hard to get an appointment,

title: Hopeless
body: Called for an appointment in the afternoon and told to call in the morning.  Call in the morning, on hold for 30mins at number 30 in the queue which means either one patient was talking the whole time, or no one was answering the phone. After nearly an hour, the surgery had reached "their safe working limit".  Called the following day at 08:00, by 08:10 the surgery "reached their safe working limit".  Stayed on hold to speak to reception - received "we are not able to take your call right now, pls call back later"  It is completely hopeless.

title: Difficulty getting routine appointment
body: Since covid, they've changed the appointments process so you can no longer book a routine appointment in advance, via phone or online. What makes it worse, is that is it's for important test results, which you can only call about after 2pm. When I called about these results yesterday, I was told to book an appointment by ringing at 8am today (as that's how you book any appointment now). I've just spent 30 mins on the phone as the lines were busy, just to find out there were no appointments left for today. This means I need to go through this process again tomorrow, with no guarantee of an appointment in the end. You should be able to make routine appointments in advance, and still have the option to call on the day, for more urgent matters, like pre-covid.

title: Unable to get appointment
body: I am a new patient and have been ring every morning to get an appointment only to be told that there isnt any. I have found a lump on my testicle and need to see a doctor asap and keep getting fobbed off. Why are you advertising for new patients when you cant give an appointment. Also been told to ring at 8am but the line is constantly busy for 20 mins and when I finally get through your in a queue which sometimes cuts off so you have to start again and when they finally answer they've got no appointments.

title: They hang up on you
body: I rang this morning after failing to get an appointment for someone to look in my ear due to ear ache last week. After half an hour on hold (I rang at 8am) and 20 minutes of being "number 2 in line". They cut the line. I have been offered a telephone appointment last week but a doctor can't look in my ear over the phone! Absolutely appalled at this surgery. They are failing patients who really need access to good quality health care.

title: Can't be bothered with patient care.
body:
Got a text to come for a flu jab as I was on immune suppressants.  Nothing was said about being over 65. The nurse was rude and made me feel humiliated.  She just wouldn't give me the flu jab and said it quite loud, so other people could hear her. I felt so humiliated.  Can't even get to see a doctor at all. Been over 2 years now.
I have been having phone calls and that's all. They used to be a caring surgery.

author: Ropro
title: Elective knee replacement surgery
body:
Went in for elective surgery knee replacement operation.  
I was nervous before being admitted but it was a very good experience.  
All the staff, from surgeons to porters, were caring, friendly, professional and efficient.  
I was able to be discharged after 2 days to recover at home.

title: New Triage system is not fit for purpose
body:
Practice had a simple app based appointment booking service, or phone in system that worked - to add to great Dr services.
Now it's been replaced with an un-workable triage NHS outsourced algo based piece of software, that wastes your time only to tell you it can't triage you. Ultimately sending you into a loop of doom wasting time. The end result, you ain't see a Dr in time and it'll simply put pressure on an overloaded A&E department, who will then tell you to see your GP, rightly so! See the doom loop? Any NHS beuaracrats seeing this? Your Drs and nurses are great, your managers and systems need a reboot of efficiency over red tape nonsense. The patient first remember??
